creator: ragaller@apache.org
text:
Currently a click on the «authoring» node in the site tab  does not do anything.

Jürgen

creator: rfrovarp@apache.org
text: *** Bug 42766 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***

creator: andreas@apache.org
text:
The reason is probably that the <nav:site> element has no href attribute:

<nav:fragment>
  <nav:site area="authoring" folder="true" label="Authoring">
    <nav:node ...

creator: andreas@apache.org
text:
(In reply to comment #2)
> The reason is probably that the <nav:site> element has no href attribute:
> 
> <nav:fragment>
>   <nav:site area="authoring" folder="true" label="Authoring">
>     <nav:node ...

Not really.
navtree.js sets the href attribute to the language suffix, which is empty in the
case of the default publication:

navtree.js:201: newSite.href = langSuffix;

creator: andreas@apache.org
text:
(In reply to comment #3)

> navtree.js sets the href attribute to the language suffix, which is empty in the
> case of the default publication:

Sorry, that should read "default language".
